basic.description: An introduction to psycholinguistic research and theory. Topics include the development of language, language perception, language production, and linguistic representation. Particular attention will be paid to applied issues in language research (e.g., speech pathology, language aids, and automatic recognition of speech).
basic.subject: PSYC
basic.title: Psycholinguistics

extra.enrollment_requirement: Prerequisites     PSYC203 or (a grade of B- in PSYC 100 and level 3 and registration in a LING plan.)
